title: X-Mas Marks The Spot
body_text:
K. FITZPATRICK vs. WOLF in Holiday Special:
ECD's First White Christmas!!
It doesn't take much to get superstars the caliber of Kevin Fitzpatrick and Justin Wolf pumped and energized, especially when on opposite sides. The incomparable powerhouse and blocking magician are as close as two friends can be off the court. But on it? Expect all hell to break loose.
The 3rd Annual Hoilday Special, ONE SIXTY-NINE - a brutally cold confrontation fought to the bitter end and neither coalition had any intentions of throwing in the towel. The early edge belonged to "Fitz", whose three-game win streak nearly forced "The Punter" to call it quits. But it wasn't over by any means.
The comeback in the works tested successfully. Wolf went on to mirror the performance - and score - of his bad-ass adversary, locking the score at 3 apiece. Two games remained and when the smoke ... wait ... when the snow cleared, legend Kevin Fitzpatrick's hand was raised in victory,
Flash Results by Game
FITZ: 1, 2, 3, 7, 8
WOLF: 4, 5, 6
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: Kevin Fitzpatrick defeated Justin Wolf, 5 - 3, at the 3rd Annual Holiday Special.
Captains Statistics
: Fitzpatrick 6-3-0 / Wolf 1-4-1.
Kevin Fitzpatrick
captained teams twice this year, having also defeated Lenny Herrera at DODGEBALL 123.
Justin Wolf
failed to claim victory the entire 2008 calendar year. He has yet to complete in anything other than a singles contest.
Moments & Stars
: Chris Adams putting on a catching clinic; Joey Smalls pelting
teammate
John Tronolone in the neck and ear
Attendance
: 16, comprised of 13 men and 3 women
Other Notes
: ONE SIXTY-NINE was
Snow War 6
, the 34th
Wet War
, and the second
Snow War
in the past three weeks.
Santa's Little Helper
The ONE SIXTY-NINE promotional poster was created by none other than Dan Spengeman.
Holiday History
You can always count on "The Writer" to promote a high-profile encounter this time a year. In 2006,
sisters Winston
waged war yet again in the sport's longest running sibling rivalry. The following December, "the biggest gift under the tree" was that of legendary performers
Tom Adams and John Tronolone's
one-on-one showdown.
________________________________________
___________
2008 concludes the same way it started ... in the main event of the year-end finale, "Legend Killer"
Michelle Mullins
attempts to chop down the mighty
Michael "Sputz" Krott
in a confrontation billed as
"David vs. Goliath"
!
Mullins won the coin toss at ONE SIXTY-NINE for the right to get first dibs on her allies. Whom will she select and further more, will she go on to defeat the mammoth competitor that stands in front of her?
Also, Information will be distributed to weekly warriors in reference to the 2008
Gold Awards
.
ECD's
Oscars return for a second year!
A wickedly colorful atmosphere, kick-ass soundtrack jumped-started by Lupe Fiasco's "Superstar", and of course the high-intensity dodgeball action will make for a night to remember! It all begins at special start time of
6pm on December 27
!
body_html:
K. FITZPATRICK vs. WOLF in Holiday Special:
ECD's First White Christmas!!

It doesn't take much to get superstars the caliber of Kevin Fitzpatrick and Justin Wolf pumped and energized, especially when on opposite sides. The incomparable powerhouse and blocking magician are as close as two friends can be off the court. But on it? Expect all hell to break loose.

The 3rd Annual Hoilday Special, ONE SIXTY-NINE - a brutally cold confrontation fought to the bitter end and neither coalition had any intentions of throwing in the towel. The early edge belonged to "Fitz", whose three-game win streak nearly forced "The Punter" to call it quits. But it wasn't over by any means.

The comeback in the works tested successfully. Wolf went on to mirror the performance - and score - of his bad-ass adversary, locking the score at 3 apiece. Two games remained and when the smoke ... wait ... when the snow cleared, legend Kevin Fitzpatrick's hand was raised in victory,

Flash Results by Game
FITZ: 1, 2, 3, 7, 8
WOLF: 4, 5, 6

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match: Kevin Fitzpatrick defeated Justin Wolf, 5 - 3, at the 3rd Annual Holiday Special.
Captains Statistics: Fitzpatrick 6-3-0 / Wolf 1-4-1.
Kevin Fitzpatrick captained teams twice this year, having also defeated Lenny Herrera at DODGEBALL 123.
Justin Wolf failed to claim victory the entire 2008 calendar year. He has yet to complete in anything other than a singles contest.
Moments & Stars: Chris Adams putting on a catching clinic; Joey Smalls pelting teammate John Tronolone in the neck and ear
Attendance: 16, comprised of 13 men and 3 women
Other Notes: ONE SIXTY-NINE was Snow War 6, the 34th Wet War, and the second Snow War in the past three weeks.

Santa's Little Helper
The ONE SIXTY-NINE promotional poster was created by none other than Dan Spengeman.

Holiday History
You can always count on "The Writer" to promote a high-profile encounter this time a year. In 2006, sisters Winston waged war yet again in the sport's longest running sibling rivalry. The following December, "the biggest gift under the tree" was that of legendary performers Tom Adams and John Tronolone's one-on-one showdown.

___________________________________________________



2008 concludes the same way it started ... in the main event of the year-end finale, "Legend Killer" Michelle Mullins attempts to chop down the mighty Michael "Sputz" Krott in a confrontation billed as "David vs. Goliath"!

Mullins won the coin toss at ONE SIXTY-NINE for the right to get first dibs on her allies. Whom will she select and further more, will she go on to defeat the mammoth competitor that stands in front of her?

Also, Information will be distributed to weekly warriors in reference to the 2008 Gold Awards. ECD's Oscars return for a second year!

A wickedly colorful atmosphere, kick-ass soundtrack jumped-started by Lupe Fiasco's "Superstar", and of course the high-intensity dodgeball action will make for a night to remember! It all begins at special start time of 6pm on December 27!
